description: The Trevor Project, founded in 1998, addresses this health disparity with a number of crisis interventions and community resources.
hq_location: PO Box 69232, West Hollywood, CA 90069

description: The HRC is responsible for implementing several programs that address the persistent forms of stigma, intolerance and inequality that affect LGBTQ+ communities.
hq_location: 1640 Rhode Island Ave. N.W. Washington, DC 20036-3278

description: LGBTQ+ college students are more likely to report having experienced sexual harassment, exclusionary or hostile conduct from peers or faculty, and even threats to their physical safety than their straight and cisgender counterparts.
hq_location: 6230 Wilshire Blvd, Ste 890, Los Angeles, CA 90048

description: The Astraea Global Arts Fund funds artistic projects by LGBTQ+ individuals or groups in music, film, fiction, dance and theater, poetry, painting and photography.
hq_location: 116 East 16th Street, 7th Floor, New York, NY 10003

description: The Family Equality Council provides many valuable resources to LGBTQ+ parents and those who want to become parents.
hq_location: 475 Park Avenue South, Suite 2100, New York, NY 10016

description: The center provides emergency housing, transitional living accommodations, trans-affirming health services, educational resources and job training for LGBTQ+ young people.
hq_location: 321 W. 125th Street, New York, NY 10027

description: The social justice organization focuses all of its efforts on advancing the civil rights of transgender people, working to advocate for awareness and equality through media campaigns and public policy.
hq_location: 1032 15th St NW, Suite 199, Washington D.C. 20005

description: As LGBTQ+ individuals get older, they may face unique challenges in navigating assisted living facilities, accessing senior care and finding support.
hq_location: 305 7th Avenue, 15th Floor, New York, NY 10001 US

description: Every student deserves to feel safe, cared for, and included at school. GLSEN, a national network of LGBTQ+ charities with over 40 chapters across 30 states, aims to help queer, trans, gay, lesbian and gender non-conforming K-12 students do just that.
hq_location: 110 William Street, 30th Floor, New York, NY 10038

description: Lambda Legal provides LGBTQ+ clients — including both organizations and individuals — with pro bono legal representation on select high-impact cases.
hq_location: 120 Wall Street, 19th Floor, New York, NY 10005

description: NAMI Urban Los Angeles (NULA) provides education about severe brain disorders, supports increased funding for research, and advocates for adequate health insurance, housing rehabilitation, and jobs for people with serious psychiatric illnesses in communities of color.
hq_location: 4305 Degnan Blvd., Suite 104 Los Angeles, CA 90008-4949

focus: Understanding treatment of mental illnesses through basic and clinical research
description: NIMH is the lead federal agency for research on mental disorders
hq_location: 6001 Executive Boulevard Rockville, MD 20852

description: The American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP) is a voluntary health organization that gives those affected by suicide a nationwide community empowered by research, education and advocacy to take action against this leading cause of death.
hq_location: 199 Water St. 11th Floor New York, NY 10038

description: Professionally trained staff and volunteer counselors respond to 20,000 calls annually with crisis intervention counseling and resource referrals to service providers in the caller’s local community. We have access to more than 5,500 free or low-cost resources for youth and families across California.
hq_location: California Coalition for Youth PO Box 161448 Sacramento, CA 95816

focus: Anxiety, depression, OCD, PTSD, and co-occurring disorder
description: ADAA is an international nonprofit membership organization dedicated to the prevention, treatment, and cure of anxiety, depression, OCD, PTSD, and co-occurring disorders through education, practice, and research.
hq_location: 8701 Georgia Avenue Suite #412 Silver Spring, MD 20910

description: Believing that when one person serves the whole family serves, Project Sanctuary takes a human-centered, solution-based approach to helping military families heal and move forward in life. Through innovative long-term programming focused on connectedness, we restore hope and empower families to recover and thrive.
hq_location: PO Box 1563 Granby, CO 80446

charity_name: To write love on her arms (TWLOHA)
description: To Write Love on Her Arms (TWLOHA) is a non-profit movement dedicated to presenting hope and finding help for people struggling with depression, addiction, self-injury, and suicide. TWLOHA exists to encourage, inform, inspire, and also to invest directly into treatment and recovery. To share the message of hope and help, TWLOHA responds to messages, meets people in their communities, operates a 'find help' tool, and provides funding to treatment and recovery efforts.
hq_location: P.O. Box 2203 Melbourne, FL 32902

focus: Emotional health for teens and young adults
description: ED is a nonprofit that exists to protect emotional health and prevent suicide for our nation's teens and young adults. We're partnering with high schools and colleges to strengthen their mental health, substance abuse and suicide prevention programs and systems. We're equipping teens and young adults with the skills and knowledge to help themselves and each other. We're encouraging community awareness, understanding and action for young adult mental health.
hq_location: The Jed Foundation 6 East 39th Street Suite 1204

description: Through nearly a century of advocacy at the national, state and local levels, Mental Health America has sought to protect the rights of individuals with mental illnesses; to undo decades of neglect and substandard care; to seek access to equitable, accessible and culturally competent services; and to seek new funding and reinvestment in both infrastructure and services in the community.
hq_location: 500 Montgomery Street Suite 820 Alexandria, VA 22314

focus: Legal services for people with mental disabilities
description: Mental Health Advocacy Services, Inc. provides free legal services to people with mental and developmental disabilities. Established in 1977, MHAS is sponsored by the Los Angeles County and Beverly Hills Bar Associations and the Mental Health Association in California. MHAS assists both children and adults, with an emphasis on obtaining government benefits and services, protecting rights, and fighting discrimination.
hq_location: 3255 Wilshire Blvd #902 Los Angeles, CA 90010

description: The Innocence Project exonerates the wrongly convicted through DNA testing and reforms the criminal justice system to prevent future injustice.
hq_location: Cardozo School of Law, New York, NY

description: EJI is a private, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that provides legal representation to people who have been illegally convicted, unfairly sentenced, or abused in state jails and prisons.
hq_location: 122 Commerce st., Montgomery, AL 36104

description: Freedom For Immigrants is dedicated to abolishing immigration detention worldwide, while ending the isolation of people currently suffering in this profit-driven system.
hq_location: 1322 Webster St., Suite 300, Oakland, CA 94612

description: Border Angels is a non-profit organization advocating for human rights, humane immigration reform, and social justice.
hq_location: 2258 Island Ave., San Diego, CA 92102

description: Common Cause manages grassroots voter protection field programs working with organizations in all 50 states to identify election reforms at all levels including expanding vote-by-mail and ensuring safe in-person voting.
he ACLU Voting Rights Project has worked to protect the gains in political participation won by racial and language minorities since passage of the 1965 Voting Rights Act (VRA).
hq_location: 125 Broad St., 18th Floor, New York, NY 10004

description: Habitat for Humanity is a global nonprofit housing organization also working across all 50 states, builds homes and communities because we believe that everyone, everywhere, should have a healthy, affordable place to call home.
hq_location: 121 Habitat Street, Americus, Georgia, United States 31709

description: The Feeding America network is the nation’s largest domestic hunger-relief organization, working to connect people with food and end hunger.
hq_location: 161 North Clark St., Suite 700, Chicago, IL 60601

description: The National Urban League is a historic civil rights organization dedicated to economic empowerment in order to elevate the standard of living in historically underserved urban communities.
hq_location: 80 Pine St., 9th Floor, New York, NY 10005

description: The NAACP is committed to dismantling racism and disrupting inequality to create a society where all people can truly be free. From city halls to the Supreme Court, using advocacy and litigation to secure civil rights for everyone.
hq_location: 4805 Mt. Hope Drive, Baltimore, MD 21215

description: Founded in 1972, the NWLC works primarily for the rights of working and low-income women on cases surrounding such issues as pay and sexual assult. The NWLC says on its website, “We champion policies and laws that help women and girls achieve their potential at every stage of their lives—at school, at work, at home, and in retirement.”
hq_location: 11 Dupont Circle NW, Suite 800, Washington, DC 20036

description: In many parts of the world, women go through prolonged childbirth without adequate care. As a result, many women develop a fistula, leaving them incontinent, and often resulting rejection from society, their families, and even their husbands. The Fistula Foundation works to prevent fistula, and provices corrective surgery to those women who are effected.
hq_location: 1922 The Alameda, Suite. 302, San Jose, CA 95126

description: Founded in 1993, Camfed works to alleviate poverty by educating young girls, enabling them to become future leaders in their societies. Camfed works with more than 6,000 schools throughout Africa to support girls, primarily in poorly served rural areas.
hq_location: 466 Geary Street, Suite 400, San Francisco, CA 94102 United States

description: Dress for Success Worldwide tackles the barriers standing between women and economic success by providing appropriate clothing, skill development, help in job search, and tools for staying relevant in today’s business world. There are numerous ways to get involved with this inspiring charity, from donating money or professional clothing, to volunteering, to setting up an affiliate in your city.
hq_location: 32 East 31st Street New York, New York 10016 United States

description: Futures Without Violence, addresses some of the most high-profile issues today. From violence in the workplace to human trafficking, to bullying, to domestic violence. The organization collects data, provides resources for all including Congress and the White House, works on awareness campaigns, and reaches out to partners of all kinds in communities.
hq_location: 100 Montgomery Street, The Presidio, San Francisco, CA 94129

description: Girls Not Brides brings together some 1300 organizations from 100 countries across the globe to fight the practice of child marriage. You can choose among numerous projects ranging from bikes for girls in Nepal to empowering girls through sports in Afganistan. Whatever project you choose, rest assured that you’ve contributed to ending this hideous practice.
hq_location: Seventh Floor, 65 Leadenhall Street, London EC3A 2AD United Kingdom

description: HKI programs combat hunger, cataract, trachoma, onchocerciasis (river blindness) and refractive error. With programs in 21 African and Asian countries plus the United States, HKI aims to reduce the suffering of people who have little access to health care because of poverty.
hq_location: 1 Dag Hammarskjold Plaza, Floor 2, New York, NY 10017 United States

description: Founded in 2005, Kiva specializes in giving loans to people, who pay those loans back. This is not a traditional charity. It is empowerment. More than one billion dollars have been lent in this way since Kiva started. Kiva is not just for women, but 81 percent of its beneficiaries are women, often entrepreneurs who found small businesses that help them, their families and their communities.
hq_location: 986 Mission Street, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103 USA

description: AnitaB.org envisions a future where the people who imagine and build technology mirror the people and societies for whom they build it. Our social enterprise supports women in technical fields, as well as the organizations that employ them and the academic institutions training the next generation. A full roster of programs help women grow, learn, and develop their highest potential.
hq_location: 1301 Shoreway Road, Suite 425, Belmont, CA 94002
